docs.lead_paragraph: Leading companies offering medical evacuation services are balking at flying Ebola patients out of West Africa for treatment abroad as the cost and the complexities of the deadly epidemic grow.

headline.main: Medical Evacuation Services Balk at Flying Out Ebola Patients
headline.print_headline: Medical Evacuation Services Balk at Flying Out Ebola Patients

docs.snippet: Leading companies offering medical evacuation services are balking at flying Ebola patients out of West Africa for treatment abroad as the cost and the complexities of the deadly epidemic grow.

docs.lead_paragraph: A charter school training program reflects the belief that teachers, like doctors, need to practice repeatedly with experienced supervisors before they can take the reins in classes of their own.

headline.main: As Apprentices in Classroom, Teachers Learn What Works
headline.print_headline: As Apprentices in Classroom, Teachers Learn What Works

docs.abstract: Aspire Public Schools, charter system with schools in California and Memphis, offers yearlong apprenticeship for prospective teachers; idea is that teachers, like doctors in medical residencies, need to practice repeatedly with experienced supervisors before they can be responsible for classes on their own; look at challenges faced by three residents while training in California's Bay Area schools noted.
docs.snippet: A charter school training program reflects the belief that teachers, like doctors, need to practice repeatedly with experienced supervisors before they can take the reins in classes of their own.

docs.lead_paragraph: Peter Provet of Odyssey House writes that the number of those who fit the criteria for substance abuse is expected to double in the next five years.
docs.snippet: Peter Provet of Odyssey House writes that the number of those who fit the criteria for substance abuse is expected to double in the next five years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug is the first complete treatment for the disease that requires a single daily pill.

headline.main: Harvoni, a Hepatitis C Drug From Gilead, Wins F.D.A. Approval
headline.print_headline: Gilead’s Hepatitis C Drug Wins F.D.A. Approval

docs.abstract: Gilead Sciences' hepatitis C drug Harvoni wins approval from Food and Drug Administration; treatment is first for the disease that requires only a once-a-day pill.
docs.snippet: The drug is the first complete treatment for the disease that requires a single daily pill.

docs.lead_paragraph: The company settled after it was accused of inappropriate billing and of providing care to nursing home residents that was effectively worthless.

headline.main: Chain to Pay $38 Million Over Claims of Poor Care
headline.print_headline: Chain to Pay $38 Million Over Claims of Poor Care

docs.abstract: Extendicare agrees to pay $38 million to resolve federal claims that it inappropriately billed for physical therapy and provided such poor care to residents that it was effectively worthless; company is one of nation's biggest nursing home chains.
docs.snippet: The company settled after it was accused of inappropriate billing and of providing care to nursing home residents that was effectively worthless.

headline.main: Bernanke Testifies That He Was Reluctant to Lend Money to A.I.G.
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Testifies That He Was Reluctant to Lend Money to A.I.G.

docs.abstract: The former Fed chief testified for a second day in the trial in which Maurice Greenberg, A.I.G.’s former chief, is suing the government, claiming the terms of A.I.G.’s bailout were too onerous.
docs.snippet: The former Fed chief testified for a second day in the trial in which Maurice Greenberg, A.I.G.’s former chief, is suing the government, claiming the terms of A.I.G.’s bailout were too onerous.
